acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It carried out the outside of Category from 48-hour EC50>=200mg/L of Crustacea (Daphnia magna) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data).

acute_toxicity_dermal.hazard_statement: May be harmful in contact with skin
acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: From LD50 value of the dermal administration test using a rat for male and females: >2000mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1999)), it was set as Category 5.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Since rat LC50 value of the inhalation exposure test (dust mists) is indicated male and females: >4.15mg/L/4H (100% purity equivalent: >1.25mg/L/4H))(Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1999)), it was set as Category 4.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale:
From male and female LD50 value of the oral administration study using rats: >5000mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1999)),  it was set as the outside of Category.

[Note] The domestic pesticide registration (herbicide) is authorized as sodium salts of this product. In this GHS classifications, all were investigated as sodium salts. For sodium salts, CAS number is 127-20-8, the formula are C3H3Cl2NaO2, and the molecular weights is 164.95. In addition, the quality of the Free body is a liquid.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since not water-insoluble (aqueous solubility =5.02*105mg/L(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)) and acute toxicity is low.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available. Corrosive to Iron (Merck, 13th, 2001)

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules. (As a sodium salt, the substance was authorized for the agricultural chemicals registration (herbicide) in the country and examined in this GHS classification. The sodium salt has the CAS number: 127-20-8, the molecular formula: C3H3Cl2NaO2, molecular weight: 164.95, and the properties of a free body: liquid.)

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of experimental data, though "Flammable solid" (BGIA GESTIS-database on hazardous substances, Accessed in 2006)

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Since the in vivo mutagenicity test has not been carried out, we presupposed that we could not classify it since data was insufficient. In addition, it gave negative for the in vitro mutagenicity test (reverse mutation test, chromosomal aberration test) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1999)).

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine and the chlorine is chemically bonded only to carbon (but not to other elements).

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Non-pyrophoric when in contact with air at a room temperature and used as agricultural chemicals.

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: It cannot be classified due to insufficient data since in the teratogenicity study using rats and rabbit, although neither of teratogenicity was indicated (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1999)),  the evaluate to fertility property was not made.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Since there is the description that "in the usual state, it is stability" in agricultural-chemicals applications for registration data (1999), and that "are stabilized at less than 150 degC"in PM (13th, 2003), it was judged as the outside of Category.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Although in the eye irritation tests using a rabbit the reversible irritation (mild corneal cloudings, conjunctival redness, and swelling) was observed, the symptom disappeared in 72 hours (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (in 1999). So it was set as Category 2B.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Although reversible stimulus (erythema and dropsy with Draize score 4) was observed in the skin irritation test on rabbits, these symptoms disappeared in 48 hours (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1999)). Therefore, it was classified as Category 3.

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Since it was negative for the guinea pig in Maximization method  (Source: Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1999)), we classified it to be out of  Category.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Stable to water (the water solubility is obtained)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Since the maximal no-effect dose is 1000 ppm (70 to 80 mg/kg/day) in the subacute toxicity study for three months of a rat (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1999)), and the observationg at the highest dose of 5000 ppm (350 to 400 mg/kg/day) was that the particular abnormality was not seen in histopathological examination except for the slight inhibition of increase in weight and increase in kidney weight of a female rat, it was classified the outside of Category.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In the rats oral acute toxicity studies (0, 2500, 5000mg/kg) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1999)), deaths was not seen and the symptom which should be mentioned specially was not acknowledged, so it is classified as the out of the Category.
